intro: Clibadium surinamense var. macrophyllum, commonly known as the giant sycamore or Surinam sycamore, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Suriname. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant has been studied for its potential medicinal properties and ecological significance in its native habitat.
